content.prompt: The Victorian shift in attitudes toward Africa described by Ferguson in Source 1 was most strongly connected to which nineteenth-century development?

choices.label: The growth of domestic social reform movements in Britain
The increased demand for African raw materials such as rubber
The incorporation of African themes and motifs into European art
The defeat of France in the Napoleonic Wars and the effective end of colonial competition with France in much of the world

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
